website_summaries.verdict: Powerful and well-built chop saw that can produce excellent results on numerous types of materials.
pros: Features a rugged 15-inch blade capacity and is powered by 1800 watts of power
Includes a 14-inch blade capable of cutting steel, wood, aluminum, and stainless steel
Owners rave about the clean cut it delivers
cons: Blade may wobble and vibrate a bit when cutting thick materials

customer_reviews.title: Hobbyist saw at best.
customer_reviews.text: This item is not a professional saw. The quality of the saw is far from being a precise cutting saw. See the video below to view the amount of play coming from the pivot pin mount.
customer_reviews.author: RCabra

customer_reviews.title: What a tool!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: If some of you men out there are basement shop welders as I, then you must get this saw. I compared many saws, some were designed to use the cutoff abrasive wheels. So very glad that I bought the Evolution!!! Like a knife cutting butter, I have cut through tube-steel, 1/4 inch bar, 2-inch angle iron, 3/4 inch rebar, and copper tubing with no problems whatsoever!! The design of the quick-detach or tighten vise works very well. Good luck to you guys. You have my highest recommendation.
customer_reviews.author: Grey Feather

customer_reviews.title: Great metal-cutting tool. Huge timesaver. Glad I got it.
customer_reviews.text: This saw is fantastic for cutting steel. I made approximately 40 cuts on some 1/4" wall, 2" X 2" steel tube and it made fast straight and angled cuts that were almost burr-free. This is so much faster than my horizontal metal cutting band saw. The blade is still cutting like it did for my first cut. My only negative is changing the back stop to cut angles. The angle guide gets you close. I have to bring the blade down to set an accurate angle with a protractor; then it's hard to see and it's cramped, but I eventually get it, so it's a minor inconvenience considering the time saved by the speed of the cuts.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This saw is for professionals
customer_reviews.text: I am 100% pleased with this saw, I'm very happy I up graded to this saw, it out proformed my expectations, I was going to buy Dewalt, this saw was a little cheaper and had good reviews, they were accurate and I'm extremely satisfied. This saw cuts 1/8"x2" angle steel as fast as my Dewalt miter saw cuts wood, and the cut is clean, no more cleaning with the flap disk. No more inhaling dust from the consumable blade. If you are doing research on metal cutting chop saw, don't waste you time. This is the best saw for the money, by far.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Carrano

customer_reviews.title: The Dewalt is great...this is greater
customer_reviews.text: Rock solid! not stamped or formed metal...this thing is cast, right down to the blade guard. Super impressed, much more solid than the Dewalt. The Dewalt is a great saw, I've used it for years, this is just better.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. T

customer_reviews.title: Quality Product.  Works Well.
customer_reviews.text: Appears well built and works well. I will never use my abrasive cut off saw again. Makes cuts with straight edges that will not burn you. The vise is much better than my abrasive cut off saw but I would have paid more for one with a vice that securely locked into preset detents, at least for ninety degree cut-offs. No reason to think this will not be a durable product but at this time I only have about 50 cuts, the thickest in 3X3 1/4" angle iron it cuts like butter. Make sure you make first contact with the steel very slowly then add pressure. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Krista Roberts

customer_reviews.title: This is one awesome metal saw!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely zero regrets on this purchase. In fact, it outperformed my expectations. I was cutting 1/8" thick, 2" square tubing to reinforce my trailer frame and it cut through like it was butter. Super clean cuts that needed no attention before being welded up. I used to do this with an angle grinder and in addition to being a mess, the cuts were never straight or clean. I would suggest purchasing ear plugs or a low cost set of ear muffs maybe like these ( as it is loud when cutting and not good for the ears. My biggest problem with the saw is keeping it out of my friends garage!!
customer_reviews.author: Scooter & Mick

customer_reviews.title: An absolute monster.
customer_reviews.text: An absolute monster when it comes to ripping through materials cleanly. I do wish the compound had some precision detents for common angles. You'll be pissing in the wind otherwise. Why did I rate it 4 stars? Because the clamp faces are not parallel, so you can't stack square stock and cut multiple pieces at once.
customer_reviews.author: jtrumpio

customer_reviews.title: Good saw with some tweaks
customer_reviews.text: As others have pointed out, this saw isn't quite square. It cuts inwards a degree or two, which is clear if you put a small 90 degree square against the blade. Gap will be at the top by 1mm (in my case) with a 3 inch square. Luckily, 4 bolts hold the saw to the base. I loosened those bolts and shimmed the right side with a 0.63mm shim (.025 inch). I didn't bother putting holes in it and running the bolts through... since the extra thickness of the mount is exactly the width of a feeler gauge. Hope this helps with anyone trying to wrestle with the saw, and at least it's a starting point to accurately shim.
customer_reviews.author: DK

customer_reviews.title: I suppose it's good for the rough saw person
customer_reviews.text: It works, but it is not any more accurate than old sparky..just cuts faster, and a pain to get accurate angle cuts. Sorry to say, it will not work for me and I'll be returning it. main reasons are, to much blade wobble to calculate for accurate cuts-vise degree label is off quite a bit- and when you think you have it in the right spot, as soon you tighten it, you end up off your mark because the vise and fence are not liking each other I guess. and the blade to base doesn't seem to be square.. I suppose it's good for the rough saw person, but from the reviews it seemed the right saw for the job...
customer_reviews.author: Chris Klein

customer_reviews.title: Just opened it and used it today. Cut 304 stainless exhaust pipe like butter !!!
customer_reviews.text: This saw was everything it was supposed to be after reading all the reviews and watching all the videos online.I got it in Friday, and opened the box today, set it up on the bench to look over and do some test cuts on some thin wall stainless 304 series exhaust tubing and it cut like butter. OH My !! I love this saw. If I still had an abrasive chop saw I would throw it in the trash. No fires no sparks just chips coming off the material. And the cut was smooth and square. Came with a chip tray and a v notch round tube adapter for clamping and squaring up on round tubing
customer_reviews.author: Doug in Madison

customer_reviews.title: Cheap quality, poor accuracy. Not worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this saw in May of 2019. Less than a year later of mild use this thing is falling apart. The steel where the chop connects to base actually cracked on mine (see photo). , the blade guard no longer operates and is stuck in closed position, the miter fence is an absolute joke. Overall it does alright for speed and power but fails majorly in accuracy and quality. This is a hobby tool and not worth the time or money of a professional.
customer_reviews.author: RKoz

customer_reviews.title: dont buy this saw!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: i bought this saw for it,s capacity , it does cut large material but it shakes real bad ! the blade is too thin for it,s diameter, and the table where the vise is does not line up with the outside frame (ie not flush or level) speaking of the vise when you turn it to an angle it falls off into the recessed areas of the table bed and is no longer perpindicular to the table ........A lot of money for a P O S
customer_reviews.author: Avlynn

customer_reviews.title: Good for the Money
customer_reviews.text: This saw works very well. It has saved me a lot of time over my cheap band saw. I have some trouble getting the angles set perfectly but it does what I need it to and has speed up my business. I did 4 stars because I've already started to strip the tightening screw. Ideally it would be acme threaded. But instead it is just a coarse thread. The angle adjustment is my other gripe. As long as you use some care, this saw will last a long time and help with productivity in your shop.
customer_reviews.author: PurduePete

customer_reviews.title: Very Satisfied - Great Customer Support
customer_reviews.text: Excellent chop saw option in this price range. I made several test cuts on some 3" square aluminum and didn't have any issue with it being out of square (once I squared it up) or looseness as others stated - nice strait cuts. I took my chance and order one that was scratched/dented - the base was cracked in half : ( I called Evolution customer support and they were fantastic, replacing the damaged part at no cost : )
customer_reviews.author: More stuff

customer_reviews.title: Great saw, Blade not so grea!
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't be more pleased with the saw. It has plenty of power for intended use! It is plenty heavy duty as described. My only beef is with the blade. I made 78 cuts with this saw, all mild steel, angle, square and round stock. Not sure what happened, whether I hit a hard place in a piece of steel or what, but I was unable to make many more cuts before having to go back to abrasive cutoff saw. Like I said, no problem with saw but this is not cost effective at the price of the blades and the amount of cuts that I made with it. Good luck!

customer_reviews.title: Overall satisfied, check blade bolt before using
customer_reviews.text: Worked well, bolt that holds the blade on was either loose or started to loosen after a couple of uses, seems fine now after tightening it down hard. Might get some thread locker to hold it in place if it loosens again. Angle adjustment was unnecessarily tight from the factory making me think some chips had lodged underneath.
customer_reviews.author: Senpai!

customer_reviews.title: Great Saw, but packaging not made for shipping

Twelve of them on a pallet, I'm sure they would be fine. I had a small chip the the underside of the cast iron base from trasport- its' outer box was destoryed- but the small chip doesn't affect performance. Over all very happy with the saw!

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed

The blade wobbles and isn’t square to the stand at all, the threads on the piece that holds the metal are showing wear and damage after about 20 cuts, and the quick release is great but doesn’t want to catch half the time when your trying to tighten down a piece for your next cut. Spend $150 more and get a commercial grade saw. At nearly $400 this should be an entry level commercial grade saw. Only reason for giving it two stars is the time savings over the abrasive saw.

customer_reviews.title: So far so good, using it to cut 3/16 galvanized angle iron

It’s not like a wood chop saw or an abrasive saw. You have to push hard enough not to bull the blade and keep the teeth engaged but not so much you slow the saw down.

customer_reviews.title: Basic saw is fine, but stainless capability is misrepresented

But I am extremely disappointed in Evolution for offering a blade for "stainless" when it's really only suitable for 304 stainless, and is NOT suitable for other alloys like 308 and 316. This is a serious limitation on a so-called "stainless" blade, and speaks to the company and how they represent their products. It's just left a really sour taste in my mouth about Evolution, and I'm unlikely to buy more of their products as a result.

product_meta.title: Evolution Power Tools EVOSAW380 15-Inch Steel Cutting Chop Saw
product_meta.description:
Evolution EVOSAW380 15-inch steel cutting chop saw offers the highest grade Industrial Metal cutting strength on the market today. When cutting steel, The EVOSAW380 cuts cold, No coolant is required. Because the material is cold It can be handled and worked on immediately.this machine cuts steel with virtually No heat, burrs, or sparks. It is ideal for cutting steel PLATE, square tube, angle iron, pipe, tube and metal roofing. Includes Evolution's 3 year warranty. The EVOSAW380 is an upgraded version of the Steelsaw2, which has been discontinued.
